column4: hi, when i start squid3, 2 process start, one from proxy user and the other is from root user. i've compiled squid3 myself
that's normal
why did you compile squid instead of using the one from the repo ?
i needed a special option. well, if it's normal, why when i want it to close the init script doesnt work?
did you write the init script or are you using the ubuntu init script ?
ubuntu init script
it starts well, but it doesnt stop
ok, so that's why, that's upstart managed,
you've probably not laid out the custom squid build in the same style so it can't get the status correctly (just guessing)
then how do i fix it?
any workaround?
you need to make your service upstart complient/configured
or write your own init script
are you sure it's normal to have 2 squid process?
yes
I'm surprised you've not read up on this before making a custom compile
no i've not. squid wiki doesnt say anything
wiki != reading up about the software you are trying to build
whoever makes the squid build for ubuntu, should add the --enable-http-violations.
i know, i thought i've read enough
then i'll have to make a custom stop script
i fixed it
it was a wrong pid filename the problem
thanks and bye
